attributes.action: World experts with UK government to decide herd immunity" is the right strategy
attributes.additional_details:
This puts alot of vulnerable people like elderly and those with immunosuppression, diabetes  and underlying cardiac and respiratory conditions  at risk which is a concern  This strategy has not been used by any other country as they opted to contain the spread of the coronavirus.
We also need WHO Director general Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus approval or advice of this proposal as his message is clear that "The idea of countries  to shift from containtent to mitigation is wrong and dangerous.
attributes.background:
Sir Patrick Vallance and Nudge unit has proposed that 60% of the population would need to be infected with coronavirus to get herd immunity. 
We need government to know what it's proposing, options of vaccine and containment considered. Prof Anthony Costello raised concerns it's against WHO policy.

rejection.details:
You might want to know that the Government has set out that 'herd immunity' is not a strategy. You can read a recent comment by the Health Secretary here:

https://hansard.parliament.uk/Commons/2020-03-16/debates/235689EC-0A18-4488-BFCF-9F012A1A0C1B/Covid-19#contribution-4215E975-1483-4CB0-A03B-1F67E4E9B990
